title: On the Relation Between Galerkin Approximations and Canonical Best-Approximations of Solutions to So.pdf
abstract: . In this paper, we establish a superconvergence property of Galerkin approximations to some non-linear Schrödinger equations of Gross-Pitaevskii type. More precisely, denoting by u∗∈ X ⊆H1(Ω) the exact solution to such an equation, by {Xδ}δ>0, a sequence of conforming subspaces of X satisfying the approximation property, by u∗ δ ∈Xδ the Galerkin solution to the equation, and by ΠX δ u∗, the (·, ·)X-best approximation in Xδ of u∗, we show – under some assumptions – that u∗ δ converges at a higher rate to ΠX δ u∗than to u∗in both the L2 norm and the canonical H1 norm. Our results apply to conforming ﬁnite element discretisations as well as spectral Galerkin methods based on polynomials or Fourier (plane-wave) expansions. 1. Background and Setting The present contribution is concerned with solutions to the following Gross-Pitaevskii type energy minimisation problems: The Source Problem E∗ src :=min u∈X  Esrc(u) := 1 2 Z Ω |∇u(x)|2 dx + 1 2 Z Ω V (x)|u(x)|2 dx + 1 4 Z Ω |u(x)|4 dx, − f, u X∗×X  , (1.1) The Eigenvalue Problem E∗ eig := min u∈X ∥u∥L2(Ω)=1  Eeig(u) := 1 2 Z Ω |∇u(x)|2 dx + 1 2 Z Ω V (x)|u(x)|2 dx + 1 4 Z Ω |u(x)|4 dx  , (1.2) under one of the following two settings: Setting One: Ω= (−1, 1)d, d ∈{1, 2, 3} and X = H1 0(Ω). Moreover, the source function f ∈Hs(Ω) for s ≥0 while the eﬀective potential V is positive and V ∈Hrv(Ω) for rv > d/2; Setting Two: Ωis a d-dimensional torus (isomorphic to the unit cell ˜Ωof some periodic lattice L in Rd), d ∈{1, 2, 3} and X = H1(Ω) (isomorphic to H1 per(˜Ω)). Moreover, the source function f ∈Hs(Ω) for s ≥0 while the eﬀective potential V is bounded below by Vmin > 0 and V ∈Hrv(Ω) for rv > d/2. 2020 Mathematics Subject Classiﬁcation. 65N15, 65N25, 65N30, 65N35. Key words and phrases. Galerkin approximation, superconvergence, a priori error estimates, non-linear Schrödinger operators, Gross-Pitaevskii equation. 1
